title: Man Utd legend Paul Scholes names Pep Guardiola and Jurgen Klopp as the two best managers in the world
text:
Paul Scholes rates Pep Guardiola and Jurgen Klopp as the two best managers in the world (Picture: Getty)

Manchester United legend Paul Scholes has named Manchester City’s Pep Guardiola and Liverpool’s Jurgen Klopp as the two best managers in the world.

Guardiola and Klopp masterminded one of the closest and most thrilling title races in Premier League history last season, with City edging out Liverpool by one point.

A similar scenario could play out this term, with defending champions Manchester City and Champions League holders Liverpool already looking head and shoulders above their domestic rivals.

Manchester City and Liverpool went head-to-head for the title last season (Pictures: Getty)

Asked who he believes is the best manager in the world, former Manchester United and England midfielder Scholes told BBC Radio 5 Live: ‘I’d still say Pep Guardiola.

‘I know Liverpool are eight points clear and they won the Champions League last year, but they’ve not won the league yet!

‘Jurgen Klopp’s a great manager, don’t get me wrong and the football they’re playing and the style of play is magnificent, but I’d still go for Guardiola after what he’s done.

‘I’d have Guardiola as number one and Jurgen Klopp as a very close number two.’

Scholes’ former club Manchester United face rivals Liverpool at Old Trafford on Sunday. Ole Gunnar Solskjaer’s side have slipped to 12th in the Premier League after a dismal run of form.

But, asked whether the Red Devils can get anything from the much-anticipated clash, Scholes said: ‘Yeah, they can. It’s just difficult to see where United’s goals are coming from.

‘It will probably have to be a bit of individual brilliance because the creativity of the team isn‘t really there, especially without Pogba playing.

The two Premier League clubs enjoyed superb seasons (Pictures: Getty)

‘Rashford is capable of it, Dan James has showed he’s capable of it, Harry Maguire could be capable of it.’

On in-form Liverpool, Scholes added: ‘Liverpool missed a big chance to win it at Old Trafford last year. I think you could argue that’s when they blew the league.

‘Liverpool were really poor on the day. We know the qualities they’ve got, we know they’re a good team, but they’ve got to come to Old Trafford and prove they can win a game there.’
